bioghist.p: Margaret Morton Creese (1899-2002) was married to James Creese (1896-1966), who was president of the Drexel Institute of Technology from 1945 to 1963. He was an outspoken opponent of the loyalty oaths instituted during the 1950s.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains newspaper and magazine articles on the influence of McCarthyism in schools collected by Margaret Creese. There are articles on attacks on teachers, textbooks, and curricula in magazines such as McCall's, Journal of the American Association of University Women, and the NEA Journal, as well as two copies of an article printed in the American Legion Magazine in 1952 entitled "Your Child Is Their Target" about the inroads into public education made by ideological forces of collectivism and socialism. The collection also includes several NEA brochures from the period and a 1952 letter from the Teachers Union of Philadelphia about the danger to civil liberties and public education posed by the House Un-American Activities hearings.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
